member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.NotesToolTip.CloseNotesToolTip(System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: The mouseReleased event listener for this object. When the specified mouse button is pressed, then released, the selected objects bounding box stops tracking the mouse cursor and disappears. The position of the selected object is updated to reflect the ending position of the mouse.
member.param: The mouse event contains status information about1 the mouse.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.NotesToolTip.OnMouseUp(System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.ProbabilityAxis.SetProbabilityTickFormat(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method specifies which minor tick marks are flagged for labels.
member.param: This parameter specifies which minor tick marks are flagged for labels. The values are interpreted as follows: 0 No minor tick mark labels 1 Place a label at tick mark 0 in each decade. 2 Place a label at minor tick marks 1 and 5 in each decade. 3 Place a label at minor tick marks 1, 2 and 5 in each decade.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.ProbabilityScale
member.summary: The ProbabilityScale class implements a cumulative normal probability coordinate system for a single coordinate, x or y. Two such scales are used to provide the scaling routines for x and y in an PhysicalCoordindates derived class, CartesianCoordinates, for example. This allows for different x and y scale types (linear, cumulative normal probability, time) to be installed independently for x- and y-coordinates.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCArrayStatistics
member.summary: Statistical routines for SPC analysis. It includes routines for the calculations of sums, means, medians, ranges, minimum values, maximum values, variances, and standard deviations. It also includes routines for array sorting and calculating frequency bins for frequency histograms. It also includes functions that compute cumulative probability values for normal, poisson, and chi-squared distributions.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCArrayStatistics.InverseNormP(System.Double)
member.summary: This method calculates the normal cdf inverse function. Let PHI(x) be the normal cdf. Suppose that Q calculates 1.0 - PHI(x), and that QINV calculates QINV(p) for p in (0.0,.5]. Then for p .le. .5, x = PHIINV(p) = -QINV(p). For p .gt. .5, x = PHIINV(p) = QINV(1.0 - p). The formula for approximating QINV is taken from Abramowitz and Stegun, Handbook of Mathematical Functions, Dover, 9th printing, formula 26.2.23, page 933. The error in x is claimed to be less than 4.5e-4 in absolute value.
member.param: p must lie between 0 and 1.
member.returns: xnormi returns the normal cdf inverse evaluated at p.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCArrayStatistics.NormP(System.Double)
member.summary: source for normal probability functions http://www1.fpl.fs.fed.us/distributions.html \ This method calculates the normal cumulative distribution function. It is based upon algorithm 5666 for the error function, from: Hart, J.F. et al, 'Computer Approximations', Wiley 1968 The FORTRAN programmer was Alan Miller. The documentation in the FORTRAN code claims that the function is accurate to 1.e-15. Steve Verrill translated the FORTRAN code (the March 30, 1986 version) into Java. This translation was performed on January 10, 2001.
member.param: no. of standard deviations from the mean
member.returns: The method returns the value of the normal cumulative distribution function at zp.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCArrayStatistics.NormCDF(System.Double)
member.summary: Translated from FORTRAN at http://www.itl.nist.gov/div898/software/datapac/NORCDF.f THIS SUBROUTINE COMPUTES THE CUMULATIVE DISTRIBUTION FUNCTION VALUE FOR THE NORMAL (GAUSSIAN) DISTRIBUTION WITH MEAN = 0 AND STANDARD DEVIATION = 1. THIS DISTRIBUTION IS DEFINED FOR ALL X AND HAS THE PROBABILITY DENSITY FUNCTION F(X) = (1/SQRT(2*PI))*EXP(-X*X/2).
member.param: value to evaluate.
member.returns: The method returns the value of the normal cumulative distribution function at x.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCArrayStatistics.PoissonCumDistribution(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Translated from FORTRAN at http://www.itl.nist.gov/div898/software/datapac/POICDF.f THIS SUBROUTINE COMPUTES THE CUMULATIVE DISTRIBUTION FUNCTION VALUE AT THE VALUE X FOR THE POISSON DISTRIBUTION WITH TAIL LENGTH PARAMETER = ALAMBA. THE POISSON DISTRIBUTION USED HEREIN HAS MEAN = ALAMBA AND STANDARD DEVIATION = SQRT(ALAMBA). THIS DISTRIBUTION IS DEFINED FOR ALL DISCRETE NON-NEGATIVE INTEGER X--X = 0, 1, 2, ... . THIS DISTRIBUTION HAS THE PROBABILITY FUNCTION F(X) = EXP(-ALAMBA) * ALAMBA**X / X!. THE POISSON DISTRIBUTION IS THE DISTRIBUTION OF THE NUMBER OF EVENTS IN THE INTERVAL (0,ALAMBA) WHEN THE WAITING TIME BETWEEN EVENTS IS EXPONENTIALLY DISTRIBUTED WITH MEAN = 1 AND STANDARD DEVIATION = 1.
member.param: THE VALUE AT WHICH THE CUMULATIVE DISTRIBUTION FUNCTION IS TO BE EVALUATED. X SHOULD BE NON-NEGATIVE AND INTEGRAL-VALUED.
THE VALUE OF THE TAIL LENGTH PARAMET
member.returns: The method returns the value of the poisson cumulative distribution function at X, ALAMBA.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCArrayStatistics.ChiSqrCumDistribution(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Translated from FORTRAN at http://www.itl.nist.gov/div898/software/datapac/CHSCDF.f/// THIS SUBROUTINE COMPUTES THE CUMULATIVE DISTRIBUTION FUNCTION VALUE FOR THE CHI-SQUARED DISTRIBUTION WITH INTEGER DEGREES OF FREEDOM PARAMETER = NU. THIS DISTRIBUTION IS DEFINED FOR ALL NON-NEGATIVE X. THE PROBABILITY DENSITY FUNCTION IS GIVEN IN THE REFERENCES BELOW.
member.param: THE VALUE AT WHICH THE CUMULATIVE DISTRIBUTION FUNCTION IS TO BE EVALUATED. X SHOULD BE NON-NEGATIVE.
THE INTEGER NUMBER OF DEGREES OF FREEDOM. NU SHOULD BE POSITIVE.
member.returns: THE CUMULATIVE DISTRIBUTION FUNCTION VALUE.

This class can be used to create PERCENT_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, FRACTION_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_PERUNIT_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_CHART SPC chart types.

member.summary: The base class for all SPC Charts. The varaible control charts and attribute control charts are both derived from this base class. It contains objects for the SPC data, chart table, two charts and two histograms.

members.member:
This initialization method initializes the most important values in the creattion of an SPC chart.
The SPC chart type parameter. Use one of the SPCControlChartData SPC chart types: MEAN_RANGE_CHART, MEDIAN_RANGE_CHART, MEAN_SIGMA_CHART, INDIVIDUAL_RANGE_CHART, CUSTOM_ATTRIBUTE_CONTROL_CHART, PERCENT_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, FRACTION_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_PERUNIT_CHART . For Variable Control Charts (MEAN_RANGE_CHART, MEDIAN_RANGE_CHART, MEAN_SIGMA_CHART, INDIVIDUAL_RANGE_CHART) this value specifies the number of samples that make up a sample subgroup. In Attribute Control Charts this value represents the number of defect categories used to determine defect counts. In Variable Control charts this value is the same as numcategories, it represents the number of samples that make up a sample subgroup. In an Attribute Control chart it represents the total sample size per sample subgroup from which the defect data is counted. Specifies the number of sample subgroups displayed in the graph at one time. /// Specifies the normal time increment between adjacent subgroup samples. ///

Initialize the class for a specific SPC chart type.
Specifies the chart type. Use one of the SPC Attribute Control chart types: PERCENT_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, FRACTION_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_PERUNIT_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_CHART.
In Attribute Control Charts this value represents the number of defect categories used to determine defect counts. In an Attribute Control chart it represents the total sample size per sample subgroup from which the defect data is counted. Specifies the number of sample subgroups displayed in the graph at one time. ///

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCChartObjects
member.summary: The SPCChartObjects class holds all of the chart objects associated with a single SPC chart. These objects include objects for data, a coordinate system, titles, axes, axes labels, grids, line and scatter plots. It also includes a FrequencyHistogramChart for displaying an adjunct histogram for monitoring the distribution of the related data values. Two SPCChartObjects objects are included in the SPCChartObject base class to manage the two possible charts in a variable control chart.

members.member:
Initialize the class for chart data for one of the SPC Control Chart types.
The Attribute Control chart type. Use one of the SPCControlChartData SPC Attribute Control chart constants: PERCENT_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, FRACTION_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_PERUNIT_CHART.
For Variable Control Charts (MEAN_RANGE_CHART, MEDIAN_RANGE_CHART, MEAN_SIGMA_CHART, MEAN_VARIANCE_CHART, INDIVIDUAL_RANGE_CHART) this value specifies the number of samples that make up a sample subgroup. In Attribute Control Charts this value represents the number of defect categories used to determine defect counts. Specifies the number of sample subgroups displayed in the graph at one time. /// Specifies the sample size per subgroup for the Attribute Control Chart. /// Specifies the normal time increment between adjacent subgroup samples. ///

In Attribute Control Charts this value represents the number of defect categories used to determine defect counts. For Variable Control Charts (MEAN_RANGE_CHART, MEDIAN_RANGE_CHART, MEAN_SIGMA_CHART, MEAN_VARIANCE_CHART, INDIVIDUAL_RANGE_CHART) this value specifies the number of samples that make up a sample subgroup. member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.SimulateMeasurementRecord(System.Double)
member.summary: Simulates a sample measurement for a SPC Variable Control chart with a specified mean value.
member.param: Samples are returned using the formula result[i] = meanvalue + meanvalue * (0.5 - ChartSupport.GetRandomDouble());
member.returns: Returns an array, size sampleSubGroupSize, of double, holding the simulated sample data.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.SimulateMeasurementRecord(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Simulates a sample measurement for a SPC Variable Control chart with a specified mean and range.
member.param: The mean of the simulated values. Samples are returned using the formula result[i] = meanvalue + range * 1.5 * (0.5 - ChartSupport.GetRandomDouble());
The range of the simulated value.
member.returns: Returns an array, size sampleSubGroupSize, of double, holding the simulated sample data.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.SimulateDefectRecord(System.Double)
member.summary: Simulates a defect measurement for a SPC Attribute Control chart with a specified mean. Used with NUMBER_DEFECTS_CHART and NUMBER_DEFECTS_PERUNIT_CHART charts.
member.param: Samples are returned using the formula result[i] = (int) (0.5 + meanvalue * 2 * ChartSupport.GetRandomDouble());
member.returns: Returns an array, size numSampleCategories, of double, holding the simulated defect data.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.SimulateDefectRecord(System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Simulates a defect record for a SPC Attribute Control chart with a specified mean. The total number of defects will be greater than or equal to the total number of defective parts.
member.param: Samples are returned using the formula result[i] = (0.5 + (totaldefectiveparts/(numSampleCategories-1)) * 2.5 * ChartSupport.GetRandomDouble());
The Attribute Control chart type, PERCENT_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, FRACTION_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTIVE_PARTS_CHART, NUMBER_DEFECTS_CHART and NUMBER_DEFECTS_PERUNIT_CHART charts.
member.returns: Returns an array, size numSampleCategories, of double, holding the simulated defect data.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.DataLogFileOpenForWrite(System.String)
member.summary: This methods will create a text file and output the SPC chart data to that file in a CSV (Comma Separated Value) format. A CSV file can be read by popular spreadsheet and word processing programs. Some localization for different operating systems and locales can be handled by the modifying the default csv (CSV) object. Uses the dataLogFlags property as the guide to reading the values of the file, so that property must be properly initialized for the data file being read.
member.param: The name of the file.
member.returns: Returns 0 if sucessful, an error code otherwise.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.DataLogFileOpenForWrite
member.summary: This methods will create a unique text file with a name defaultDataLogFilenameRoot + Month + Day + Year + hour + Minute + second, and output the SPC chart data to that file in a CSV (Comma Separated Value) format. A CSV file can be read by popular spreadsheet and word processing programs. Some localization for different operating systems and locales can be handled by the modifying the default csv (CSV) object. Uses the dataLogFlags property as the guide to reading the values of the file, so that property must be properly initialized for the data file being read.
member.returns: Returns 0 if sucessful, an error code otherwise.

member.name: M:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.DataLogFileOpenForWrite(System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: This methods will create a text file and output the SPC chart data to that file in a CSV (Comma Separated Value) format. A CSV file can be read by popular spreadsheet and word processing programs. Some localization for different operating systems and locales can be handled by the modifying the default csv (CSV) object.
member.param: The name of the file.

The datalogflags value controls what items are logged to the data log file. The default has all of the optional items logged to the file. "OR" together individual data log file flags to specify the items you want logger to the file. For example: datalogflags = DATALOG_FILE_TIME_STAMP | DATALOG_FILE_SAMPLED_VALUES | DATALOG_FILE_CALCULATED_VALUES | DATALOG_FILE_COLUMN_HEADS. Use one of the SPCControlChartData datalog: DATALOG_FILE_BATCH_NUMBER, DATALOG_FILE_TIME_STAMP, DATALOG_FILE_SAMPLED_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_CALCULATED_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_CONTROL_LIMIT_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_NOTES, DATALOG_FILE_COLUMN_HEADS.

A user defined string that can appear on the second line of the data log file, between the file prefix and the column heads. The datalogflags must have the DATALOG_USER_STRING option set before this string is output to the file.
member.returns: Returns 0 if sucessful, an error code otherwise.

For example: datalogflags = DATALOG_FILE_TIME_STAMP | DATALOG_FILE_SAMPLED_VALUES | DATALOG_FILE_CALCULATED_VALUES | DATALOG_FILE_COLUMN_HEADS. Use one of the SPCControlChartData datalog: DATALOG_FILE_BATCH_NUMBER, DATALOG_FILE_TIME_STAMP, DATALOG_FILE_SAMPLED_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_CALCULATED_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_CONTROL_LIMIT_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_NOTES, DATALOG_FILE_COLUMN_HEADS.
member.returns: Returns 0 if sucessful, an error code otherwise.

member.name: P:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.DataLogFlags
member.summary: Set/Get the flags that control what items are logged to the data log file. The default has all of the optional items logged to the file. "OR" together individual data log file flags to specify the items you want logger to the file. For example: DatalogFlags = DATALOG_FILE_TIME_STAMP | DATALOG_FILE_SAMPLED_VALUES | DATALOG_FILE_CALCULATED_VALUES | DATALOG_FILE_COLUMN_HEADS. Use one of the SPCControlChartData datalog: DATALOG_FILE_BATCH_NUMBER, DATALOG_FILE_TIME_STAMP, DATALOG_FILE_SAMPLED_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_CALCULATED_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_CONTROL_LIMIT_VALUES, DATALOG_FILE_NOTES, DATALOG_FILE_COLUMN_HEADS.

member.summary: Set to true to enable data logging. If a data log file has not been previously opened with DataLogFileOpenForWrite, a new data log file is created using the default name, combined with a time stamp.

member.name: P:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlChartData.DefaultDataLogFilenameRoot
member.summary: Default string used as the default file name for data logging. Only used if data logging turned on and the DataLogFileOpenForWrite has not been initialized with an explicit filename. The current time is appended to the root to make it a unique filename.

member.summary: The string used as the file name for data logging. Set when the DataLogFileOpenForWrite is called.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord
member.summary: This class hold information specific to an SPC control limit: including the current value of the control limit, a history of control limit values, description, and the hysteresis value for alarm checking.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_GREATERTHAN_LIMIT
member.summary: Specifies the alarm is a greater than alarm.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_LOWERTHAN_LIMIT
member.summary: Specifies the alarm is a lower than alarm.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_NOTA_LIMIT
member.summary: Specifies the limit is not an alarm, just a value.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_DEFAULT_CONTROL_RULE
member.summary: Same as SPC_WE_1 (1 out of 1 outside 3-sigma limit).

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_WE_0
member.summary: Specifies no Western Electric control rule .

member.summary: Specifies Western Electric control rule 1 (1 out of 1 outside 3-sigma limit).

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_WE_2
member.summary: Specifies Western Electric control rule 2 (2 out of 3 outside 2-sigma limit).

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_WE_3
member.summary: Specifies Western Electric control rule 1 (4 out of 5 outside 1-sigma limit).

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_WE_4
member.summary: Specifies Western Electric control rule 1 (8 out of 8 on one side of center line).

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.SPC_CUSTOM_CONTROL_RULE
member.summary: Specifies a custom control rule).

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.controlLimitType
member.summary: The SPCControlLimitRecord class stores alarm information for the SPCControlChartData class. The SPCControlLimitRecord class specifies the type of the alarm, the alarm color, alarm text messages and alarm hysteresis value. The SPCControlChartData classes can hold an unlimited number of SPCControlLimitRecord objects in a ArrayList.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.controlLimitValue
member.summary: Specifies the default value.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.controlLimitValues
member.summary: A historical record of the control limit values.

member.name: F:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCControlLimitRecord.hysteresisValue
member.summary: Specifies the hysteresis value used in the alarm module. A process variable will go into alarm when the parameterValue is exceeded, it will fall out of alarm when the process value is less than parameterValue - hysteresisValue.

member.summary: Specifies true if the process variable is currently in alarm.

member.summary: Specifies the previous alarm state, last time the alarm was checked.

member.name: T:com.quinncurtis.spcchartnet.SPCGeneralizedTableDisplay
member.summary: This class manages a list of ChartText objects (NumericLabel, StringLabel and TimeLabel objects), that encapsulate each unique table entry in the SPC chart table. This class also manages the spacing between the rows and columns of the table, and the alternating stripe used as a background for the table.

member.summary: Constant specifies that the next row to the table should user text row spacing.

member.summary: Constant specifies that the next row to the table should user numeric row spacing.

member.summary: Constant specifies that the table does not use a background color.
